sentence.Network_en: Level 1 - Summons an Infernal with weak Pulverize and average attack.
sentence.Network_cn: 一级 - 召唤一个具有一般攻击力的地域火.

sentence.Network_en: Pulverize the rebellion before it gets out of hand.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这些反叛成气候之前,必须彻底消灭之.

sentence.Network_en: Level 3 - Summons an Infernal with a devastating Pulverize and deadly attack.
sentence.Network_cn: 三级 - 召唤一个具有惊人攻击力的地域火.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin pulverizare, from pulvis, pulver- 'dust'

entry.def: To pulverize something means to do great damage to it or to destroy it completely.

example.ex: ...the economic policies which pulverised the economy during the 1980s...
example.tran: 20世纪80年代使经济遭受了重创的经济政策

example.ex: A factory making armaments had been bombed the night before and a residential area not far away had been pulverized.
example.tran: 前天晚上，一家兵工厂被炸，不远处的居民区也被夷为平地。

entry.def: If someone pulverizes an opponent in an election or competition, they thoroughly defeat them.

example.ex: He is set to pulverise his two opponents in the race for the presidency.
example.tran: 他决心在总统竞选中彻底击垮他的两个对手。

entry.def: If you pulverize something, you make it into a powder by crushing it.

example.ex: Using a pestle and mortar, pulverise the bran to a coarse powder...
example.tran: 用杵和臼，将麸皮磨成粗粉。

example.ex: The fries are made from pellets of pulverised potato.
example.tran: 这些炸土豆是土豆泥球做成的。

means.word_mean: 1. make into a powder by breaking up or cause to become dust;

sentences.sentence: "pulverize the rebellion before it gets out of hand"
"When it was blown up, the building powderized"

sentences.en: He pulverize the opposition with the force of his oratory.
sentences.cn: 他能言善辩把对方驳得体无完肤。
